@HOOP_hands_off @LaCasaRonzoni They were even elected-ish They were chosen by the senior nobles from the Tanists, men who had a great-great- grandfather (or closer) who had been king. Sounds grand in theory, but in practice a lot of Tanists died violently. Primogeniture was adopted in around the 11th century.

@HOOP_hands_off @LaCasaRonzoni We've had kings and queens of Scots from time immemorial - Ard Righ nan Albannach is the ancient title, High King of Scots. Because they were the leaders of the people, not the owners of the land.
